Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured pottery band- or lip-cup; interior: glazed; exterior: handle zone reserved with letters in black. "E.TOS..S." (between sigmas a damaged area with white deposit), black below; hole drilled for ancient repair below the epsilon.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 418, B649)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 695, no. 519) (Bernand also gives this as his number 766, erroneously calling it 'figure rouge')
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234, no. 22.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1364)
